title: The world in brief
content: The world in briefCatch up quickly on the global stories that matterUpdated1 hour agoGavin Newsom, Californiaâ€™s governor, said the state would sue the Trump administrationfor sendingNational Guardtroops toLos Angelesamid violent anti-deportation protests. Demonstrators hurled fireworks and stones while officers responded with tear gas and rubber bullets, marking the third day of such clashes. Mr Trump, who called the protesters â€œviolent mobsâ€, said the troops would restore â€œorderâ€. Mr Newsom said the Trump administration wanted a â€œspectacleâ€.Israelseized a boat carrying activists and aid as it headed towardsGaza. TheMadleen, a British-flagged yacht, was intercepted by forces as it tried to break Israelâ€™s naval blockade of the territory. The Freedom Flotilla Coalition, the pro-Palestinian group operatingMadleen, said the ship was â€œunlawfully boardedâ€.Israelcalled the vessel a â€œselfie yachtâ€ and said that its passengers (who include Greta Thunberg, a Swedish climate activist) would â€œreturn to their home countriesâ€.
